medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe epigastric pain radiating to the back, nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after the patient underwent an ERCP for choledocholithiasis and Mirizzi's syndrome. The patient presented to the ED with severe pain and exhibited elevated lipase levels.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease (CAD) status post myocardial infarction (MI) with two stents placed, systolic congestive heart failure (CHF) with ejection fraction of 45%.
medical_history.family_history: No cancer; both parents have coronary artery disease (CAD).
